Eating a diet that is rich in high-quality protein is very important for people with liver disease. Protein helps build and repair muscles. It also helps heal infections. How much protein should I eat? Ask your doctor how many grams (g) of protein you should eat every day. Most times, target goals for people with liver disease are: • For each meal: 21 to 28 g protein • For each snack: 7 to 14 g protein The goal is to eat 80 to 100 g of protein a day. To reach this goal, eat 11 to 13 servings of protein spread throughout the day. Which foods are highest in protein? Choose foods from the table on this page to increase the protein in your diet.
